intro: Bidens angustissima var. linifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils in open areas such as marshes and stream banks. It produces small, herbaceous stems and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a common species in wetland ecosystems and a potential indicator of soil moisture conditions.
